question: This is great, I could've spent four months on a romantic comedy with Warren Beatty, and instead, I've got a horny zombie trying to cop a feel! Uhgh, there's water everywhere... Can I get a cigarette? Geoff? Anybody see my boy?
answer: Right here, Mom...

question: How long have you been here?
answer: Couple minutes. I saw the last shot. That was pretty cool.

question: How did it go with your father last night?
answer: Good. He said he'd be over for dinner at eight... I mean... he misses you, Mom...

question: I miss him too... I just don't want you to get your hopes up, okay? We're trying to work things out, but...
answer: I know, Mom.

question: You know everything, don't you?
answer: Guess it's showtime.

question: Yep. That's what you said the first time...
answer: He grins as he watches the scene unfold.

question: It's awful. She shakes, her SMOKING HANDS frozen to the iron railing by the electricity running through her...
answer: Mom!!!!

question: Mom!!!!
answer: I think this is probably for the best. He's a very old dog. He has arthritis. He has cataracts in his eyes... He's had a good life... ...haven't you, boy?

question: No... You have to bring her back...
answer: Oh Jesus...

question: Let's keep it back, folks. Try to show her a little respect... Hey! What did I just say? Did she always have reporters following her around like this?
answer: Pretty much so.

question: I hear you moved into town.
answer: I wanted to get Geoff out of L.A. Just start things over, you know?

question: I remember when Renee left. She couldn't wait to get out of Ludlow. She used to say that life moved too slow here...
answer: That's Renee alright.

question: I suppose so.
answer: ...Geoff, what if we just give the clothes to Goodwill? We'll keep the rest. Just the clothes.

question: All the 'Renee' boxes go in the attic. Sorry.
answer: Hi. I'm Marjorie Hargrove. Your new housekeeper. Is something wrong?

question: Uh... no. You just... look different than you sounded on the phone. Please, come in.
answer: I'm real excited about working for you Mr. Matthews...

question: Well we're glad to have you, Marjorie. You can call me Chase, by the way.
answer: I've always admired Ms. Hallow. That scene she did in Blue Midnight, where her lover meets her at the train station... I must've watched that movie four times. Oh. I'll get that... This is gorgeous. She wore this at the Emmys, didn't she?

question: Hey, don't touch her stuff. It made her crazy when people touched her stuff.
answer: This doesn't look so bad...

question: How long ago did this guy retire?
answer: It's been a few years.

question: A few?
answer: What's wrong?!

question: Nothing. I just got spooked by a bunch of furballs.
answer: Great, now I've opened an orphanage too.

question: Well, I'll take one. If it's okay... She looks like a tiger.
answer: Tell you what, you do some sweeping up here, and she's yours.

question: Let's have him hop up here.
answer: When I was young I thought cats were the girls and dogs were the boys.

question: There are three more girls where that one came from looking for homes.
answer: Not our home.

question: Thee facial lacerations should heal up pretty quickly. I'll give you som antibiotic cream--
answer: --Drew, he's your dog. Are you listening to this?

question: His left eye is scratched, corneal abrasion. Eyedrops will help, but it's going to take som time. Try to keep him away from those rabbits, huh?
answer: I hear you've got Marjorie Hargrove working for you now.

question: How'd you know that?
answer: It's a small town, Chase. Hey Geoff, did you know your mother and I used to be high- school sweethearts?

question: What's a lunch cost these days? You want ten?
answer: Sure.

question: You nervous? New town, new school. I know it must be pretty hard for you...
answer: I'll be fine, Dad.

question: Geoff... you have to help me out here a little... Are you sure you don't want me to pick you up. It's a long ride.
answer: That's what my bike's for...

question: That's what my bike's for...
answer: Check it out. That's the new kid. The son of that movie star.

question: No.
answer: What's the hurry, Junior? Where you off to? Too bad about your Mom. Papers said it was pretty gross, getting fried like that. Guess you saw it, huh? So, what are you hiding there?

question: Her name's Tiger.
answer: Tiger? Don't you think that's kind of a pussy name? Can I hold her? I promise I'll be real careful. Hey, Geoff. You ever seen a kitten run?

question: I've seen her run around the house.
answer: No, I mean really run... Like this!

question: Shit...
answer: Having fun yet?

question: Just give me the cat, all right?
answer: I would but... there was a little accident... She was trying to get away. You know, running down my leg... and her head got too close to the spokes. Pretty gross. What's left of her is up in the Pet Sematary. A zip-lock bag might help... ...but I happen to be out of them at the moment.

question: I would but... there was a little accident... She was trying to get away. You know, running down my leg... and her head got too close to the spokes. Pretty gross. What's left of her is up in the Pet Sematary. A zip-lock bag might help... ...but I happen to be out of them at the moment.
answer: Come on, Clyde, just tell him where the cat is...

question: ...I TOLD HIM where the cat is! Now shut up, fuck-face! You heard about the Creed murders yet? And the place where the dead come back to life? It's just back there. Just down that path...
answer: Clyde... it's not funny anymore.

question: I've never seen anybody punch Clyde before.
answer: He pissed me off.

question: Sorry about your mom. I couldn't handle not having my mom around. Just having Gus...
answer: My dad's not so bad.

question: I swear, sometimes I wish Gus was dead...
answer: You shouldn't ever say that about your parents, not even your Dad.

question: Stepdad. Gus is my stepdad.
answer: What was all that stuff about dead people coming back to life?

question: comes upon a break in the trees. The hanging moon outlines the knoll stretching beyond. And then, the strained breathing, the hushed WHIMPER.
answer: I was just going by your house. Where's your bike?

question: Zowie's dead. I have to bury him. I don't want to go out there alone.
answer: Is this a good spot?

question: I'm not burying him here...
answer: Why not?

question: There's a better place... It's back here somewhere, through the Indian woods. I know we can find it...
answer: Hey, wait up! Drew, where are we going?

question: This is it... I wasn't sure if it even really existed.
answer: What did?

question: The old Indian burial ground.
answer: Come on, that's just a bullshit story. You said so yourself...

question: What if it's not bullshit? If I bury Zowie there, and it works... ...he'll come back alive.
answer: Drew, I know your dog died, but... get a grip, man, you're freaking me out.

question: Look, if there was even one chance in a million it'd work, wouldn't you want to try?
answer: Look, let's just get this over with.

question: If this doesn't work... don't ever tell anyone I did this, okay? You gotta promise...
answer: You want me to help?

question: You have to bury your own. That's the way the Indians did it. It's like a rule... What if he really does come back? I've never had anyone die before... ...but I guess you get over it. I mean, eventually...
answer: You never get over it. It's getting pretty late. We better go.

question: Geoff... Geoff!
answer: What?

question: You alright?
answer: Dad... do you think... ...you think you and Mom would've gotten back together?

question: I think so. Your Mom and I loved each other, Geoff. Don't ever think that we didn't.
answer: I still can't believe she's dead... Who was that?

question: Remember Zowie, Drew's dog? He got hurt again. I'm going over to take a look at him.
answer: I'm going with you.

question: You're home early.
answer: Nope. Just ran out of smokes. Where's the boy?

question: Uh... in his room...
answer: DREW! God damn it, Amanda! You want me to be a father to the boy, and as soon as I lay down the law, you let him break it! Where is he? WHERE IS YOUR SON!?

question: cowers on the ground, trying to scramble away.
answer: You get out of here, Geoff Matthews! This is between me and my boy! Call off your dog, Drew. Drew, call him off!

question: Zowie...
answer: DREW!

question: Were you drinking? Drew's Mom called hours ago, the rest of the kids were back by ten. Where the hell were you boys?
answer: Just out.

question: "Out." Well that's great, Geoff. Look, I've been letting you get away with a lot these past few weeks, but I'm not going to stand for crap like this. I don't care if it's Halloween... it's a school night, and if you do this again...
answer: I'm really tired, Dad... can I just go to sleep?

question: Take your pick. They're in the boarding area. You can go on back. Elliot, it's Chase... I didn't get that...
answer: ...I said next time it might help if you took the blood sample while the animal was still alive...

question: What?
answer: I don't know what you expected to find, Matthews. There's nothing wrong with the antigens, nothing to indicate an unusual death...

question: Wait, there must be some mix-up. He was... the dog is alive.
answer: Not this dog. There wasn't enough oxygen in those red cells to pump life into a flea. You took over for Doctor Yolander?

question: Yes... why?
answer: Because the last person that sent me blood from a dead animal was Yolander...

question: Yeah... that's fine... Listen, Drew, I got the tests back on Zowie. He's not well. Don't ask me how, but he got out this afternoon... If he finds his way home, call me, no matter what the hour, okay? And don't try to approach him. Whatever he's got might be infectious. Understand? Can I have the address for Quentin Yolander?
answer: You'd be so much more interesting with blue eyes... I'm immortalizing a poodle. State your business!

question: Doctor Yolander. This is Chase Matthews. I've moved into your offices in Ludlow... ...I sent a blood sample out for analysis. They tell me I sent them the blood of a dead animal... ...a dog...
answer: Why are you bothering me about this? Can't you leave it be?

question: I... um... ...the pathologist... he said that you had reported a similar incident... with a cat...
answer: The Creed cat, that's right. Bastard's name was "Church". Let me guess. Your dog's tissue isn't healing, pupils aren't dilating... maybe you can't find a heartbeat?

question: Exactly! I thought it might be some sort of blood condition... immune deficiency or...
answer: There's no "blood condition." The dog isn't sick, it's dead. And so was Creed's cat. And so was his wife the night she was killed for the second time... You want some advice, friend? You get in your car, you pick up your family... and you get the hell out of that town.

question: No... Too heavy. ...can't breathe... I can't...
answer: I didn't mean to... I was going to empty the hamper...

question: It's okay.
answer: What happened to you?

question: I had a little run-in with Zowie.
answer: You sure did... Here, let me do that... I hope he doesn't have rabies.

question: He doesn't. I don't know what he has, but I'm hoping to God it's not infectious... Marjorie... what do you know about the Creed murders?
answer: Did you ever play that game where you pass a story down a row of people and see how screwed up it gets by the time it's done? People say Louis Creed's son came back from the dead and it drove him crazy... He killed his wife and himself, and that's the end of story. Anything else belongs in the National Enquirer. Sorry. Now tell me what that has to do with Zowie?

question: Do you think everyone that came back would be like Gus?
answer: I don't know... ...maybe it depends on what you were like before you...

question: Dies?
answer: I gotta go back and do my chores...

question: Go later...
answer: I can't. Gus'd kill me if I showed up late. See you at school Monday? You ever think about running away?

question: All the time.
answer: See ya!

question: rips by on an old junkyard fixer-up MOTORCYCLE, and he's heading in Geoff's direction. Well look who's here! Oops! Guess your Dad's not here to save you now, is he? You ever seen a tire take off a nose? Neither have I. Might even kill ya. Wheel might chew right into your brains. You could visit your mom. Jesus Christ, Gus!
answer: Go home. I said... GO HOME!!

question: Come on, Gus, I was just fucking with him... What're you gonna do? Give me a ticket? I mean, shit, Gus... You can't lay a finger on me... Gus... what are you doing?
answer: I'm just fucking with you...

question: Stop it, man! Stop it!!!
answer: Whoops.

question: Whoops.
answer: Oh man...

question: This is the Police, come out of the house with your hands up!
answer: No, Zowie! It's me! Stay back!

question: Forget something, Drew buddy? You have the right to remain silent... ...while I bash your fucking head in! You have the right to a lawyer, but you won't need one... ...cause you'll be dead! Do you understand these rights, Drew buddy?!
answer: Gus killed Clyde, Mom! He's trying to kill me!

question: Drew, buddy! Daddy's not done yet!
answer: Go Mom! Go!!! Mom!!!

question: Geoff... what are you doing?
answer: I'm getting things ready for Mom.

question: Mom is dead, Geoff. You know that...
answer: She doesn't have to be.

question: What are you talking about?
answer: I can bring her back. The same way Drew and me brought Zowie back...

question: Geoff, this is crazy. Zowie didn't die.
answer: He did. We buried him. There's a place out in the woods... if you bury something there, it comes back alive. We tried it on Zowie first. And then we did it again, when Zowie killed Gus. Drew didn't want Gus to be dead, so we brought him back, too...

question: Jesus...
answer: standing in a swath of light. At Gus' feet is Zowie, tongue lolling out of his mouth. Dead for the second time. Scattered around the dog are various tools.

question: Gus, what are you doing?!
answer: I was building a doggy door.

question: God damn it Gus, you dug up my wife! What the fuck is going on around here?!
answer: A little drilling. A little killing.

question: Holy shit!
answer: God I hate when that happens... You got a permit for that? Didn't think so. No brain, no pain, Chase. Think about it... Just remember, Chase... I had Renee first... and now I'm gonna have her last...

question: Marjorie?
answer: Hello, Chase.

question: Oh my God...
answer: We can try again, Chase. We can make it work this time.

question: No...
answer: Don't you love me anymore, Chase?

question: You're not Renee... Renee's dead... Geoff! Get over here now!
answer: Geoff, honey, why don't you go downstairs. Your father and I need a moment alone. Do it for me? Geoff... I love you.
